Name: Araku Valley
Type: Hill Station / Scenic Valley / Tribal Culture / Parks / Museum
Nearest Railway Station: Araku Railway Station (~120 km from Visakhapatnam)
Nearest Bus Stand: Araku Bus Stand (~1 km from town center)
Opening/Closing Times: Open all day; Tribal Museum 10 AM – 6 PM (closed Mondays)
Accessibility: Hilly terrain; some spots not wheelchair accessible
Nearby Amenities: Tribal Museum, coffee shops, local dhabas, gardens
Special Notes: Famous for Araku Coffee, Tribal Museum, Padmapuram Gardens, Chaparai Waterfalls

Name: Borra Caves
Type: Natural Limestone Caves / Geological Site / Religious Shrine
Accessibility: Uneven cave floors, steps; not wheelchair friendly
Special Notes: Discovered by William King (1807); stalactites/stalagmites and Shiva shrine inside

Name: Belum Caves
Type: Natural Underground Cave System / Geological Wonder / Historical Site
Accessibility: Narrow passages, steps; not wheelchair friendly
Nearby Amenities: AP Tourism Haritha Hotel, food stalls, restrooms
Special Notes: Second-largest cave system in India; Buddhist relics; musical chamber

Name: Kolleru Lake & Bird Sanctuary
Type: Freshwater Lake / Bird Sanctuary / Wildlife Attraction
Accessibility: Boat rides needed; basic wheelchair access at entry
Nearby Amenities: Rest areas, small eateries, eco-tourism huts
Special Notes: Largest freshwater lake in India; Ramsar wetland site

Name: Gandikota
Accessibility: Fort accessible by foot; gorge viewpoints require walking
Nearby Amenities: AP Tourism Haritha resort, eateries, camping
Special Notes: Known as Grand Canyon of India; popular for camping and stargazing

Name: Konda Reddy Fort
Accessibility: Steps and uneven surfaces; not wheelchair friendly
Special Notes: Built by Vijayanagara rulers; named after Konda Reddy

Name: Gooty Fort
Accessibility: Trek up hill needed; not wheelchair accessible
Special Notes: Known as Rachakonda Fort; mix of Vijayanagara and Islamic architecture

Name: Kanaka Durga Temple
Accessibility: Wheelchair assistance available
Special Notes: One of the Shakti Peethas; on Indrakeeladri Hill

Name: Undavalli Caves
Accessibility: Steps at entrance; not fully wheelchair accessible
Special Notes: 4th–5th century caves; monolithic Vishnu statue

Name: Prakasam Barrage
Accessibility: Road bridge accessible by vehicles and pedestrians
Special Notes: Built across Krishna River; iconic symbol of Vijayawada

Name: Sir Arthur Cotton Museum
Official Website: AP Tourism – Sir Arthur Cotton Museum
Accessibility: Wheelchair accessible
Special Notes: Exhibits on Godavari Barrage and irrigation works

Name: Godavari Bridge(s)
Accessibility: Public road/rail bridges accessible
Special Notes: Three major bridges; popular for photography and boat rides

Name: Draksharamam Temple
Accessibility: Limited wheelchair assistance
Special Notes: Built by Eastern Chalukyas; part of Pancharama temples

Name: Srisailam
Nearest Airport: Rajiv Gandhi International Airport, Hyderabad (~200 km)
Accessibility: Wheelchair assistance available; steep ghat roads
Special Notes: One of 12 Jyotirlingas; inside tiger reserve

Name: Mantralayam
Accessibility: Wheelchair-friendly mutt premises
Special Notes: Famous for samadhi of Sri Raghavendra Swamy

Name: Papikondalu
Type: Natural River Gorge / Scenic Boat Cruise
Nearest Railway Station: Rajahmundry Railway Station (~60 km to boat point)
Accessibility: Limited wheelchair facilities on boats
Nearby Amenities: Food included on boat trips; lodges in Rajahmundry
Special Notes: Breathtaking Godavari gorge; mini Amazon experience

Name: Maredumilli
Accessibility: Roads accessible, but trails and waterfalls not wheelchair-friendly
Parking: Available at eco-tourism centers and waterfalls
Nearby Amenities: AP Tourism Haritha resort, tribal dhabas, famous bamboo chicken stalls, small shops
Special Notes: Known as “Ooty of Andhra”, famous for bamboo chicken

Name: Tirupati
Type: Pilgrimage (Tirumala Venkateswara Temple) / Spiritual / Hill Station
Opening/Closing Times: Temple timings vary (4 AM – 1 AM); open all day
Entry Fee: Free; special darshan ₹300, Seva tickets higher
Accessibility: Wheelchair assistance available on hill
Nearby Amenities: Tons of accommodation, restaurants, shops, TTD services
Special Notes: One of the most visited pilgrimage sites in the world

Name: Talakona Waterfalls
Accessibility: Uneven terrain, steps; not wheelchair accessible
Special Notes: Highest waterfall in Andhra Pradesh; located in Sri Venkateswara National Park

Name: Pulicat Lake
Accessibility: Boats are main mode of transport; not wheelchair-friendly
Nearby Amenities: Basic food stalls, small guest houses
Special Notes: Second largest brackish water lagoon in India; famous for flamingos

Name: Horseley Hills
Nearest Airport: Tirupati Airport (~150 km), Bengaluru Airport (~165 km)
Accessibility: Accessible by car; some viewpoints require walking
Nearby Amenities: AP Tourism Haritha Hotel, restaurants, tourist attractions
Special Notes: A quaint hill station; known for its pleasant weather

Name: Lambasingi
Accessibility: Hilly roads; not suitable for wheelchair-bound travelers
Special Notes: Called 'Kashmir of Andhra Pradesh' due to its occasional sub-zero temperatures

Name: Kambalakonda Wildlife Sanctuary
Accessibility: Walking trails; not wheelchair-friendly
Special Notes: Located near Visakhapatnam; a good day trip for nature lovers

Name: Thotlakonda & Bavikonda
Accessibility: Relatively accessible; some walking on uneven ground
Special Notes: Ancient Buddhist sites overlooking the Bay of Bengal

Name: Rampa Waterfalls
Accessibility: Requires a short trek; not wheelchair-friendly
Special Notes: A beautiful waterfall in a secluded location; less crowded

Name: Kondapalli Fort
Accessibility: Steps and uneven terrain; not wheelchair-friendly
Parking: Available at the base of the fort
Special Notes: Famous for Kondapalli toys made from lightwood

Name: Ethipothala Waterfalls
Accessibility: Viewpoint is accessible, but to go to the base is difficult
Special Notes: A stunning 70-foot waterfall formed by the Chandravanka River
